definitions: solid swelling of clotted blood within body tissues caused by broken blood vessels
examples: The boxer developed a large hematoma above his eye
An ice pack can help reduce the size of a hematoma
The doctor examined the hematoma on her thigh after the fall
Severe hematomas may require surgical drainage

definitions: half of a sphere, especially half of the Earth divided by the equator or a meridian
either of the two halves of the brain
examples: Australia is located in the Southern Hemisphere
Summer in the Northern Hemisphere begins in June
The left hemisphere controls language in most people
Brain hemispheres have different specialized functions

definitions: highly poisonous plant with small white flowers and finely divided leaves
large evergreen coniferous tree native to North America
examples: Socrates was executed by drinking hemlock poison
Wild hemlock grows near streams and wet areas
The forest was filled with towering hemlock trees
Hemlock wood is used for construction and paper

definitions: red protein in blood cells that carries oxygen from the lungs to body tissues
examples: Low hemoglobin levels can indicate anemia
The doctor ordered a hemoglobin test
Hemoglobin gives blood its characteristic red color
Athletes often have higher hemoglobin concentrations

definitions: hereditary disorder in which blood does not clot properly, leading to excessive bleeding
examples: His hemophilia requires regular clotting factor injections
Hemophilia mainly affects males due to its genetic pattern
The royal families of Europe historically carried hemophilia
Modern treatment has greatly improved life for hemophilia patients

definitions: escape of blood from a ruptured blood vessel, especially when profuse
rapid and uncontrollable loss or outflow of something
examples: The patient suffered a brain hemorrhage after the accident
Emergency surgery stopped the internal hemorrhage
The company faced a hemorrhage of talented employees
The scandal caused a hemorrhage of public support

definitions: tall plant grown for its strong fibers used in rope, textiles, and other products
examples: Hemp rope is known for its strength and durability
Farmers are growing hemp for industrial purposes
Hemp seeds are nutritious and high in protein
The cultivation of hemp is now legal in many places

definitions: adult female chicken kept for its eggs or meat
examples: The hen laid fresh eggs every morning
Several hens pecked around the farmyard
A broody hen sat protectively on her nest
Free-range hens produce better quality eggs

definitions: faithful follower or supporter, especially one prepared to engage in crime or violence
examples: The villain's henchmen carried out his evil plans
Political henchmen distributed bribes to voters
The mob boss never went anywhere without his henchmen
Corporate henchmen enforced the CEO's unpopular policies

definitions: reddish-brown dye obtained from a plant, used especially for coloring hair and skin
examples: She decorated her hands with intricate henna designs
The bride's henna ceremony lasted several hours
Natural henna gives hair a reddish tint
Henna tattoos are popular at summer festivals

definitions: official messenger bringing news or making proclamations
person or thing that announces or signals the approach of something
examples: The herald announced the king's arrival at court
Royal heralds wore colorful ceremonial uniforms
Spring flowers herald the end of winter
The new technology heralds a revolution in medicine

definitions: system of designing, displaying, and studying coats of arms and heraldic symbols
examples: Medieval heraldry identified knights in battle
The family studied heraldry to trace their ancestry
Heraldry uses specific terms for colors and designs
The college of heraldry maintains official records

definitions: book describing plants and their culinary and medicinal properties
examples: The ancient herbal contained remedies for common ailments
She consulted an herbal for natural healing methods
Medieval monks compiled detailed herbals
Modern herbals include scientific plant information

definitions: person who practices healing using plants and prepares or sells herbs for medicinal purposes
examples: The herbalist recommended echinacea for her cold
Local herbalists gather wild plants for remedies
She trained as an herbalist in traditional Chinese medicine
The herbalist's shop smelled of dried plants and roots

definitions: chemical substance used to kill unwanted plants, especially weeds
examples: Farmers spray herbicide to protect their crops
Organic gardens avoid using chemical herbicides
The herbicide effectively controlled the invasive weeds
Overuse of herbicides can harm the environment

definitions: animal that feeds only on plants and plant materials
examples: Cows and sheep are common herbivores
Herbivores have special digestive systems for plants
The largest dinosaurs were herbivores
Herbivores play important roles in their ecosystems

definitions: large group of animals that live or are kept together
large group of people typically with shared characteristics
examples: A herd of cattle grazed in the pasture
The elephant herd protected its young
The herd of tourists followed their guide
Don't follow the herd; think for yourself

definitions: person who looks after a herd of livestock or makes a living from keeping livestock
examples: The herder guided sheep across the mountain pass
Nomadic herders move with their animals seasonally
Young herders learn skills from their elders
The herder counted his goats every evening

definitions: man who owns or takes care of a herd of domestic animals
examples: The herdsman led his cattle to fresh pastures
An experienced herdsman can identify each animal individually
The herdsman's life follows the rhythm of seasons
Local herdsmen supplied milk to the village

definitions: from now on or at some time in the future
life after death according to some religious beliefs
examples: Hereafter, all meetings will start at nine o'clock
The rules stated hereafter must be followed
Many religions promise rewards in the hereafter
She believed they would reunite in the hereafter

definitions: passing of physical or mental characteristics genetically from one generation to another
examples: Eye color is determined by heredity
Scientists study heredity to understand genetic diseases
Both heredity and environment shape personality
The laws of heredity were discovered by Mendel

definitions: belief or opinion contrary to orthodox religious doctrine, especially Christianity
examples: The church condemned his teachings as heresy
Medieval heresy often resulted in severe punishment
Scientific discoveries were sometimes labeled heresy
She was accused of heresy for questioning doctrine

definitions: person believing in or practicing religious heresy
examples: The heretic was excommunicated from the church
Medieval heretics faced persecution and death
Galileo was branded a heretic for his scientific views
Some heretics later became recognized as reformers

definitions: organism having both male and female reproductive organs
examples: Many snails are hermaphrodites
Some fish change from hermaphrodite to single sex
Hermaphrodite plants can self-pollinate
Earthworms are hermaphrodites but still mate in pairs

definitions: person living in solitude as a religious discipline or from a simple desire to be alone
examples: The hermit lived alone in a mountain cave
She became a hermit after years in the city
Buddhist hermits seek enlightenment through isolation
The old hermit rarely spoke to visitors

definitions: secluded residence of a hermit or group of hermits
examples: The ancient hermitage clung to the cliff face
Pilgrims visited the hermitage seeking wisdom
She retreated to a hermitage for meditation
The hermitage provided simple shelter and solitude

definitions: condition in which part of an organ pushes through the wall of the cavity containing it
examples: Heavy lifting caused his hernia to worsen
The surgeon repaired her abdominal hernia
Hernias often require surgical treatment
He wore a support belt for his hernia

definitions: very brave or dramatic action or behavior showing great courage
examples: The firefighter's heroic rescue saved three lives
Despite heroic efforts, they couldn't save the building
Her heroic struggle against cancer inspired many
The team made a heroic comeback in the final minutes

definitions: highly addictive illegal drug derived from morphine
examples: Heroin addiction destroys lives and families
The clinic treats patients recovering from heroin use
Police seized a large shipment of heroin
Heroin overdoses have reached epidemic levels

definitions: woman admired for her courage, outstanding achievements, or noble qualities
chief female character in a book, play, or movie
examples: The war heroine received the nation's highest honor
Local heroines were recognized at the ceremony
The novel's heroine overcomes many obstacles
She played the heroine in the action movie

definitions: great bravery and courage, especially in facing danger
examples: The soldier's heroism earned him a medal
Acts of heroism during the disaster saved many lives
Everyday heroism often goes unrecognized
Their heroism in standing up to injustice inspired others

definitions: large wading bird with long legs, neck, and bill, typically gray or white
examples: A great blue heron stood motionless in the shallow water
The heron caught fish with lightning-fast strikes
Herons nest in colonies called heronries
We spotted several herons along the riverbank

definitions: contagious viral infection causing blisters on the skin or mucous membranes
examples: Cold sores are caused by the herpes simplex virus
Herpes outbreaks can be managed with medication
The doctor explained that herpes is very common
Stress can trigger herpes flare-ups

definitions: small silver fish that swims in large schools and is important as food
examples: Pickled herring is a traditional Scandinavian dish
Fishing boats caught tons of herring
Smoked herring makes a tasty breakfast
Herring are an important part of the ocean food chain

definitions: pattern consisting of rows of parallel lines sloping in opposite directions
examples: She wore a classic herringbone tweed jacket
The herringbone pattern added visual interest to the floor
Herringbone tile creates an elegant backsplash
His suit featured a subtle herringbone weave

definitions: unit of frequency equal to one cycle per second
examples: Radio waves are measured in megahertz
The monitor refresh rate is sixty hertz
Human hearing ranges from 20 to 20,000 hertz
The electrical grid operates at fifty hertz

definitions: state of being hesitant or slow in acting or speaking due to uncertainty
examples: Her hesitancy to commit frustrated the team
There was noticeable hesitancy in his response
Vaccine hesitancy poses public health challenges
His hesitancy cost them the opportunity

definitions: pause before saying or doing something, especially through uncertainty
examples: She accepted the job offer without hesitation
His brief hesitation revealed his doubts
A moment's hesitation can mean missing your chance
There was hesitation in her voice

definitions: quality or state of being diverse in character or content
examples: The heterogeneity of the population created rich cultural exchanges
Genetic heterogeneity complicates disease research
The heterogeneity of opinions made consensus difficult
Tumor heterogeneity affects treatment effectiveness

definitions: person sexually attracted to people of the opposite sex
examples: Most surveys assume respondents are heterosexual
The support group welcomes people of all orientations, including heterosexuals
Heterosexual couples can legally marry worldwide
Both heterosexual and homosexual relationships deserve respect

definitions: quality or characteristic of being sexually attracted to people of the opposite sex
examples: Heterosexuality has been the assumed norm in many societies
The study examined attitudes toward heterosexuality
Heterosexuality is one of several sexual orientations
Cultural views of heterosexuality vary globally

definitions: practical method for solving problems that may not be optimal but is sufficient for immediate goals
examples: The programmer used a heuristic to speed up the search
Simple heuristics often produce good results
Trial and error is a basic heuristic
The heuristic approach yielded quick solutions

definitions: magic spell or curse intended to bring bad luck
hexagon or hexagonal shape
examples: The witch supposedly put a hex on the village
They believed a hex caused their misfortunes
The floor tiles were arranged in a hex pattern
Hex bolts have six-sided heads

definitions: plane figure with six straight sides and six angles
examples: Honeycomb cells form perfect hexagons
The stop sign is shaped like a regular hexagon
She drew a hexagon using a compass and ruler
Hexagons tile together without gaps

definitions: star-shaped figure formed by two intersecting equilateral triangles
examples: The hexagram appears on the flag of Israel
I Ching uses hexagrams for divination
She wore a silver hexagram pendant
The hexagram symbol has ancient origins

definitions: period of greatest success, popularity, activity, or vigor
examples: In its heyday, the factory employed thousands
The actress recalled her heyday in Hollywood
The railroad's heyday ended with the automobile
Jazz had its heyday in the 1920s

definitions: pause or gap in a sequence, series, or process
examples: The band returned after a five-year hiatus
She took a hiatus from acting to raise her children
The show went on hiatus during the summer
After a brief hiatus, negotiations resumed
